abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the project is
            rated as satisfactory. Key lessons for all projects include:
            a) It is important to ensure ownership within the concerned
            ministry. b) There should be an appropriate match between
            project objectives and indicators for measuring the
            objectives, and indicators for the achievement of targets
            should be selected and set for different stages of the
            project. c) Assembling the correct project implementation
            team in country is a key factor for successful project
            implementation and Bank staff should provide technical
            advice to Government and support for this exercise. d)
            Establishing more than one special account separately
            managed for different components of a project creates
            problems in fund management and monitoring. e) Clarity of
            design contributes to successful project implementation. f)
            While it is difficult to forecast cost increases accurately
            when designing a building component, procedures and
            methodologies for approving these during construction, and
            reporting procedures to provide advance information and cost
            trends, should be agreed in advance. g) To ensure
            sustainability, project outcomes and actions required should
            be addressed fully with the Government in the preparation of
            any follow-up project. The report also include key lessons
            learned for educational projects.
